org.simalliance.openmobileapi
Class FileViewProvider.FCP

java.lang.Object
  org.simalliance.openmobileapi.FileViewProvider.FCP
Enclosing class:
FileViewProvider
public class FileViewProvider.FCP
extends Object

File Control Parameter contain information of a selected file. FCPs are returned after a file select operation.

Note: This class is based on ISO/IEC 7816-4 FCP returned by the SELECT command as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects).

FileViewProvider.FCP

                     throws IllegalArgumentException

rawTlvData - The data to be used in the initialization.
Throws:

Method Detail

getFCP

public byte[] getFCP()
Returns the complete FCP as byte array.

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects).

Returns:
The complete FCP as byte array.

getFileSize

public int getFileSize()
Returns the file size of the selected file (Number of data bytes in the file, excluding structural information).

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects).

Returns:
The file size depending on the file type:
  • DF/MF: the total file size represents the sum of the file sizes of all the EFs and DFs contained in this DF plus the amount of available memory in this DF. The size of the structural information of the selected DF itself is not included.
  • EF: the total file size represents the allocated memory for the content and the structural information (if any) of this EF.

INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE if the information is not available.

getTotalFileSize

public int getTotalFileSize()
Returns the total file size of the selected file (Number of data bytes in the file, including structural information if any).

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects).

Returns:
The total file size depending on the file type:
  • DF/MF: the total file size represents the sum of the file sizes of all the EFs and DFs contained in this DF plus the amount of available memory in this DF. The size of the structural information of the selected DF itself is not included.
  • EF: the total file size represents the allocated memory for the content and the structural information (if any) of this EF.
INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE if the information is not available.

getFID

public int getFID()
Returns the file identifier of the selected file.

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects).

Returns:
The file identifier of the selected file. INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE if the FID of the selected file is not available.

getSFI

public int getSFI()
Returns the short file identifier of the selected EF file.

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects).

Returns:
The short file identifier of the selected file. INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE if selected file is not an EF or an SFI is not available.

getMaxRecordSize

public int getMaxRecordSize()
Returns the maximum record size in case of a record based EF.

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects).

Returns:
The maximum record size in case of a record based EF. INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE if the currently selected file is not record based or the information can not be fetched.

getNumberOfRecords

public int getNumberOfRecords()
Returns the number of records stored in the EF in case of a record based EF.

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects).

Returns:
The number of records stored in the EF in case of a record based EF. INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE if the currently selected file is not record based or the information can not be fetched.

getFileType

public int getFileType()
Returns the file type of the currently selected file.

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects). The file type is based on the definition in table 14 (File descriptor byte).

Returns:
The file type:
  • (0) DF
  • (1) EF
INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE if the information can not be fetched.

getFileStructure

public int getFileStructure()
Returns the structure type of the selected EF.

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects). The file type is based on the definition in table 14 (File descriptor byte).

Returns:
The structure type of the selected file:
  • (0) NO_EF
  • (1) TRANSPARENT
  • (2) LINEAR_FIXED
  • (3) LINEAR_VARIABLE
  • (4) CYCLIC
INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE if the information can not be fetched.

getLCS

public int getLCS()
Returns the life cycle state of the currently selected file.

Note: This method is based on the FCP control parameter as specified in ISO/IEC 7816-4 in chapter 5.3.3 (File control information) in table 12 (File control parameter data objects). The LCS is based on the definition in table 13 (Life cycle status byte).

Returns:
Returns the life cycle state of the currently selected file.
  • (0) NO_INFORMATION_GIVEN
  • (1) CREATION_STATE
  • (2) INITIALISATION_STATE
  • (3) OPERATIONAL_STATE_ACTIVATED
  • (4) OPERATIONAL_STATE_DEACTIVATED
  • (5) TERMINATION_STATE
INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE if the information can not be fetched.
